info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:34PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SHELBY, LOGAN AND SOUTHERN HARDIN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 334 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kenton to near De Graff, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Bellefontaine, Kenton, Jackson Center, Russells Point, Lakeview, Belle Center, West Mansfield, Chippewa Park, Northwood, Roundhead, Mount Victory, Rushsylvania, Huntsville, Port Jefferson, Ridgeway, Zanesfield, New Jerusalem, Pfeiffer, Mcmorran and Maplewood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
